net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.ui

Class MultitapAlertDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Dialog
      • android.app.AlertDialog
        • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.ui.MultitapAlertDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface, android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class MultitapAlertDialog
extends android.app.AlertDialog
implements android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener
    Allows specification of a number of multiple taps before the positive button takes action. Unlike the standard AlertDialog, this class is its own builder. Special thanks to @dapayne1 for the original inspiration. When using the Android Compatibility Library, see also MultitapAlertCompatDialog.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.1 (#21)

        The number of taps required to execute the positive button's action.

      • m_resPositiveLabelFormat

        protected int m_resPositiveLabelFormat
        The resource ID of the string which formats the positive button's label. This defaults to a left-to-right format, but may be changed to a right-to-left format at runtime if the context demands it.
        See Also:
        R.string#label_btnMultitapPositive_LTR, R.string#label_btnMultitapPositive_RTL

      • m_sPositiveLabel

        protected java.lang.String m_sPositiveLabel
        The positive button label. This will be used as the first part of the string format.
        See Also:
        m_resPositiveLabelFormat, R.string#label_btnMultitapPositive_LTR, R.string#label_btnMultitapPositive_RTL

      • m_taskPositive

        protected java.lang.Runnable m_taskPositive
        The task to be executed if the positive button is tapped sufficiently.

      • m_taskNegative

        protected java.lang.Runnable m_taskNegative
        The task to be executed if the negative button is tapped.

      • m_btnPositive

        protected android.widget.Button m_btnPositive
        Once the dialog is constructed, this will hold a persistent reference to the positive button itself, so that we can dynamically update its text.

        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setPositiveButton

        public MultitapAlertDialog setPositiveButton(int resLabel,
                                             java.lang.Runnable task)
        Add a positive button with the specified label, such that the specified task is executed when tapped the requisite number of times.
        Parameters:
        resLabel - the label for the button
        task - the task to be executed
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setPositiveButton

        public MultitapAlertDialog setPositiveButton(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Add a positive button which will execute the specified task when tapped the requisite number of times. The Android standard "OK" text (R.string.ok) will be used as the button label.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be executed
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setNegativeButton

        public MultitapAlertDialog setNegativeButton(int resLabel,
                                             java.lang.Runnable task)
        Add a negative button with the specified label, such that the specified task is executed when tapped once.
        Parameters:
        resLabel - the label for the button
        task - the task to be executed
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setNegativeButton

        public MultitapAlertDialog setNegativeButton(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Add a negative button which will execute the specified task when tapped once. The Android standard "Cancel" (R.string.cancel) will be used as the button label.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be executed
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setStandardButtons

        public MultitapAlertDialog setStandardButtons(java.lang.Runnable taskPositive,
                                              java.lang.Runnable taskNegative)
        Sets up a standard "OK" positive button and a standard "Cancel" negative button, using the specified tasks.
        Parameters:
        taskPositive - the task to be executed if the positive button is tapped the requisite number of times
        taskNegative - the task to be executed if the negative button is tapped once
        Returns:
        (fluid)

        Regenerates the label of the positive button, showing the difference between the number of taps required and the number of taps already intercepted.
        Returns:
        the positive button label
